programme.title: Earths Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: How animals and plants deal with the changes in the environment that occur every autumn. As summer ends, animals have to prepare for the winter ahead. Chipmunks and beavers hurry to hoard their winter supplies before the weather grows colder, while musk oxen and beetles find they only have one more chance to mate before the year is out and young gannets face the first dangerous challenge of their lives. Narrated by Andrew Scott

programme.title: Stonehenge: The Lost Circle Revealed
programme.desc: Using cutting-edge research, a dedicated team of archaeologists has compiled the evidence to fill in a 400-year gap in mans knowledge of the bluestones of Stonehenge. By combining innovative 3D scanning techniques, traditional field archaeology and novel laboratory analysis, the team has discovered where the stones were quarried and where they first stood. Professor Alice Roberts shows how the team made its discoveries and joins Professor Mike Parker Pearson to piece together the final parts of the puzzle, solving one of the toughest challenges ever faced by archaeologists

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson presides over another duel of words and wits as Frank Muir, Joanna Lumley and Russell Harty take on Patrick Campbell, Nanette Newman and Bryan Forbes. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Judith Jackson, Robin Ray and Patrick Moore. With guest musician Louis Kentner. First broadcast 1977

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 1993 documentary exploring three decades of Soviet space culture,from the glory days of Yuri Gagarin to the saga of cosmonaut Sergei Krikalev, whose return from the Mir space station was delayed due to the dissolution of the Soviet Union

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: An edition from 2007 celebrating the first 150 years of the Tube, the worlds oldest underground railway system and a peculiarly British institution used by three million people every day. Through poetry, music and film, the stories of passengers and drivers are woven into reconstructions of the networks history, beginning with a public hanging in 1863 and including its wartime use as a massive air raid shelter

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Hubert Dreyfus to examines the principles developed by Edmund Husserl, Martin Heidegger and other modern existentialist philosophers such as Jean-Paul Sartre and Maurice

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Sidney Morgenbesser to discuss the work of CS Pierce, John Dewey and William James, known collectively as the American pragmatists

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Judith Jackson, Robin Ray and Patrick Moore. With guest musician Louis Kentner. First broadcast 1977

programme.title: Stonehenge: The Lost Circle Revealed
programme.desc: Using cutting-edge research, a dedicated team of archaeologists has compiled the evidence to fill in a 400-year gap in mans knowledge of the bluestones of Stonehenge. By combining innovative 3D scanning techniques, traditional field archaeology and novel laboratory analysis, the team has discovered where the stones were quarried and where they first stood. Professor Alice Roberts shows how the team made its discoveries and joins Professor Mike Parker Pearson to piece together the final parts of the puzzle, solving one of the toughest challenges ever faced by archaeologists

programme.title: Inside Museums
programme.sub-title: Inside Museums: The Story of Slate
programme.desc: Huw Stephens tells the story of the Welsh slate industry with a visit to the National Slate Museum in Llanberis, including the story of the great quarry strike of 1900-1903

programme.title: Railway Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury visits north-east Scotland to walk along the Speyside Way. The route, which runs between the villages of Craigellachie and Ballindalloch, was the path of a railway that served a remote area and a world-famous drinks industry

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Jerry takes out yet another endowment policy and Tom and Barbara begin to have misgivings about their plans for old age. Special performance of the classic comedy that was originally recorded in the presence of Elizabeth II and Prince Philip and first broadcast in 1978

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: The government faces financial ruin, but that does not seem to worry Sir Humphrey, who goes to extreme lengths to get his latest pay rise scheme approved. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: How Danish corporate lawyer Amira Smajic teamed up with investigative journalists to set up corrupt clients in front of hidden cameras. Amira Smajic set up her new office and let her former clientele know she was back in business. Soon cases started coming through the door, including the illegal disposal of toxic waste and a complicated money laundering scam. In Danish

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: A look at how the ties between the Danish underworld and the Danish establishment tightened as legal advice was sought for businesses looking to manage bankruptcies in a way that would avoid attracting scrutiny. Also, a call from another of Smajics clients from Pakistan, in which claimed he was going to eliminate a witness due to testifying against him in court. In Danish

programme.title: Turner: The Man Who Painted Britain
programme.desc: Tim Marlow presents this documentary drama chronicling the highs and lows of JMW Turners life, including his tragic childhood, secret affairs and the exhausting extremes to which he pushed himself to capture a unique quality in his paintings. Ross Boatman stars as the artist

programme.title: Britains Outlaws: Highwaymen, Pirates and Rogues
programme.sub-title: Knights of the Road: The Highwaymans Story
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis explores the criminal underworld of Britain in the 17th and 18th centuries, beginning with the arrival of the highwayman in the wake of the English Civil War. Heavily romanticised in literature, these glamorous gangsters became a social menace on the roads and a political thorn in the side of the creaking British state, but a far darker reality lay underneath the dashing image of stylish robbers on horseback

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: An edition from 2007 celebrating the first 150 years of the Tube, the worlds oldest underground railway system and a peculiarly British institution used by three million people every day. Through poetry, music and film, the stories of passengers and drivers are woven into reconstructions of the networks history, beginning with a public hanging in 1863 and including its wartime use as a massive air raid shelter

programme.sub-title: Inside Museums: The Story of Slate
programme.desc: Huw Stephens tells the story of the Welsh slate industry with a visit to the National Slate Museum in Llanberis, including the story of the great quarry strike of 1900-1903

programme.title: Railway Walks with Julia Bradbury

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Louise Minchin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Insurer Says Im Wrong About Having Cancer
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Louise Minchin investigate the life insurance policies that have left viewers ineligible for a payout while battling serious health conditions, including one company refusing to accept a woman has cancer. Plus, the new parking schemes that could spell the end for airport scammers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A former care centre is converted into a smart family home in Waterlooville, developers sort out a house with subsidence in West Bromwich and a refurbished semi-detached home is given as a gift in Birkenhead

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and Tim Weeks help the teams search for bargains at Stoneleigh antiques fair to sell in Derby. Eric Knowles meets the son of Jamaican-born weightlifter Louis Martin

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: A scammer pretending to be from a mobile phone company targets a woman who is desperate to get to a doctors appointment. He promises her a free gift of Apple AirPods, but he is just after the money in her bank account. With so much at stake, the team have just a small window of time to try to intercept the call

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Richard from Bolton wants to create a pyrography business at home so he can be around more for his son. His mentor Eben thinks the key to his success as a heat-applied decorator might come from collaborating with a whisky distillery. Connie, from Co Down, wants to push herself outside of her comfort zone and properly establish an embroidery business. Mentor Stephanie thinks she has the talent and potential to do well, but needs to define herself as an animal artist for success. Presented by Dominic Chinea

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson visits the Isle of Man to find a new home for a retired nurse who knows the island better than he does. They take a trip on the Snaefell Mountain Railway

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam are in to Chesterfield transform a steep weed-filled garden into a healing space for Finn and Miriam, who is recovering from cancer.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Phil Serrell and Tahmina Ghaffar begin a journey across Merseyside and Cheshire, snapping up a Mexican hat pig feeder and a delicately hand-painted Chinese glass bottle

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When one of the lads in a local rugby team is attacked, Donal wonders if its a case of jealousy between the players or whether theres something more serious going on. Marlene and Eve arent getting on, so when Marlene sees Eves husband looking intimate with another woman, she wonders what she should do. Cameron Cuffe, Kerri Quinn and Tara Lynne ONeill star

programme.title: If Walls Could Talk
programme.desc: Cookstown Railway Station in Co Tyrone was once a thriving transport hub, connecting this rural community to the cities and beyond closed to passengers in 1956. Nowadays it is the home of Cookstown Hockey Club, retaining its place at the heart of Cookstown life

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Vicki struggles to cope after hearing that Joel is pleading not guilty, while Suki and Eve try to broker peace between Ravi and the family ahead of the adoption assessment. At the Vics quiz night, Zoe decides to play matchmaker between Freddie and Anna

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Britain and China: Following the Money - Panorama
programme.desc: Britain faces a huge challenge in its relationship with China. Can it do business with a rising superpower while keeping the UK safe? Reporter Celia Hatton has been following Chinese state money that flowed into UK business over the last two decades. With access to new research, and interviews with those at the heart of key deals, she reveals how the state was far more active than may have been realised at the time. Was the UK outsmarted by Beijings long-term planning? And what does it tell us about how Britain reckons with Chinas power today?

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Singer and actor Antony Costa, Paralympian and actor Gaz Choudhry, drag artist Ginger Johnson, actress Katie McGlynn and reality star Uma Jammeh compete in the first heat of the celebrity contest. Judges Grace Dent and John Torode challenge them to make a dish using a secret ingredient, before a blindfold test in which they must identify cubes of meat, fish or fruit by touch and taste only. Finally, they have one hour to cook a dish for their own food stall

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kym Marsh present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Broadband Firms Trapped My Car with a Telegraph Pole
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Louise Minchin and Gloria Hunniford hear from the homeowner who was shocked to find a telegraph pole blocking their car in - which they claim was installed without any warning. Also, the red flags to watch out for when looking for a reputable modelling agency

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The three properties being bought in this edition feature family partnerships - a husband, wife and daughter team in Madeley, Shropshire, brothers-in-law in Castleton, Derbyshire, and an entire family in Newton Aycliffe, Co Durham, get stuck in. All three renovations throw up unexpected issues, but will family harmony remain intact? Presented by Martin Roberts and Martel Maxwell

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp visits the National Tramway Museum in Derbyshire. while experts Kate Bliss and Danny Sebastian guide the teams around a fair at Heanor

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: The team take on a patronising and manipulative scammer who seeks to convince a woman in Essex to hand over information for him to get into her bank account

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Stone carver Richard from Northumberland and stained-glass artist Kate from the Lake District hope Dom Chinea and his team of mentors can transform their businesses and their lives

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Briony May Williams helps a London buyer who wants a dream North Yorkshire cottage for her and her beloved dog Buddy. Briony also meets a family living on the edge of the moors who now roast their own coffee beans for their thriving cafe

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Memories of five years ago when widower Maureen, who had relocated from Spain, wished for a garden that reminded her of her life with her late husband, evoking the mountain views and vibrant colours of the Mediterranean. Did the result endure? Charlie Dimmock also returns to see the zoned garden she designed for Daniel and Siddharth, which has since blossomed into a mature garden filled with fruit, vegetables and flowers. Plus, a catch-up with Judith from Beeston in Nottingham, who wanted a Scandinavian-inspired garden to enjoy with her friends, especially for their Friday-night Fizz Club

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Phil Serrell and Tahmina Ghaffar hit the East Riding of Yorkshire, where items of interest include vintage butchers signs, a sleek 1960s chair with a sci-fi connection and a curious contraption for reaching high shelves. The pair also find out about a powerhouse of a Yorkshire lass who fought her way to boxing glory

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki and Eve try to silence Avani and Nugget as they join in the argument, while Vicki panics as Damon lies on the floor, but Zack arrives and springs into action to protect her. Zoe discovers someone has bombarded the Vic with bad reviews online

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Antony Costa, Gaz Choudhry, Ginger Johnson, Katie McGlynn and Uma Jammeh have their cooking capabilities pushed even further as chef Karan Gokani, creative director of Hoppers restaurants, teaches them how to deliver one of his technically challenging recipes. After that, they are left to serve up a main course and a dessert of their own choosing - aware that for one of them, this will be their last time in the kitchen. Hosted by Grace Dent and John Torode

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Crews are dispatched to a 78-year-old man who was found collapsed at home as the result of a cardiac arrest, but despite minutes of CPR, critical care paramedic Nick must deliver some heartbreaking news to the patients family. In Wakefield, Shekinah and Tash are dispatched to 54-year-old Paula, who has been struggling with breathlessness for several days, and in Leeds, Amrish and Rachel are dispatched to 73-year-old Howard, who has fallen and been left on the floor for more than two hours

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Hell for Leather: The Story of Gaelic Football
programme.desc: Armagh legend Oisín McConville reveals the magic and mayhem that led Tyrone, Donegal, and Armagh to All-Ireland victory, while the Cork ladies become one of the games greatest teams ever. Plus, the crucial influence of managers and mentors, planners and motivators who make champions of their teams and reinvent the game year on year

programme.title: In My Own Words
programme.sub-title: In My Own Words: Yinka Shonibare
programme.desc: The British-Nigerian visual artist Yinka Shonibare gives a rare interview about his life and career, prompted by archive footage, photographs and home movies. Topics include the moment his sculpture, Nelsons Ship in a Bottle, was unveiled on the fourth plinth in Trafalgar Square in 2010, and his emotional homecoming trip to Nigeria - the first time he had been able to go back to see friends and family for 30 years. He also talks about the impact of the spinal virus he contracted as a teenager, which left him paralysed down one side of his body

programme.title: Tell Me Lies
programme.desc: Stephen and Lucy both have weekend guests who visit Baird for Halloween. Evan has second thoughts about Bree, who is having a weekend getaway with Oliver. Lucy and Pippa learn something unsettling from a school-wide email

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: An Incan youngster suffers the worst birthday ever, a Roman farmer receives a visit from an unconventional salesman, and George IV embarks on a solo music career

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Live International Football
programme.desc: Northern Ireland v Luxembourg (Kick-off 7.45pm). Stephen Watson presents all the action from both teams final FIFA World Cup Group A qualifier, held at Windsor Park. Goals by James Reid, Shea Charles and Justin Devenny gave Northern Ireland a 3-1 victory when the sides met at Stade de Luxembourg in the opening round of fixtures. Michael ONeills men will expect another win on home territory against a nation that lost their first four matches in the group, though the minnows have at least been competitive, with Germany the only team to overcome them by more than a two-goal margin

programme.title: Men of the Manosphere
programme.desc: James Blake enters the virtual world of manhood, often referred to as the manosphere, in search of status, wealth and relationships. He meets three young men who have turned to male social media influencers for guidance and instruction as they seek to better themselves and achieve success in different areas of their lives, both on and offline

programme.title: Eddie Hall: The Beast v the Mountain
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes access to Halls preparations for a Dubai bout with fellow former Worlds Strongest Man Hafthor Bjornsson, who gained fame as The Mountain in Game of Thrones. The pair were once close friends, but had a bitter falling out in 2017 and opted to settle their differences in the ring in what was dubbed as the heaviest boxing match in history. The documentary also looks at Eddies personal story, which has seen him struggle with mental health issues earlier in his life as he obsessively chased his goals

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. After a video featuring a female prison officer and an inmate having sex inside HMP Wandsworth goes viral, journalist Mobeen Azhar begins an investigation into what happened and why. A year of twists, turns and damning revelations pulls back the curtain on a dangerous wider world of coercion, corruption and contraband thriving behind bars

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mobeen Azhars investigation into prison corruption uncovers the murder of a former officer who had been involved in exposing an illicit relationship. When news breaks of a prison governor being jailed for a relationship with a drug-dealing gang boss, Mobeen becomes determined to uncover the true extent of criminal influence inside our prisons

programme.title: Men of the Manosphere
programme.desc: James Blake enters the virtual world of manhood, often referred to as the manosphere, in search of status, wealth and relationships. He meets three young men who have turned to male social media influencers for guidance and instruction as they seek to better themselves and achieve success in different areas of their lives, both on and offline

programme.title: Eddie Hall: The Beast v the Mountain
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes access to Halls preparations for a Dubai bout with fellow former Worlds Strongest Man Hafthor Bjornsson, who gained fame as The Mountain in Game of Thrones. The pair were once close friends, but had a bitter falling out in 2017 and opted to settle their differences in the ring in what was dubbed as the heaviest boxing match in history. The documentary also looks at Eddies personal story, which has seen him struggle with mental health issues earlier in his life as he obsessively chased his goals

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The educational sketch show reveals unusual remedies used during the reign of the Stuarts, and explains the history of tea. HHTV Sports follows a feud between warring Viking families, and a city-based youngster experiences a culture clash during the Second World War after being evacuated to a farm

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Wales v North Macedonia (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from the FIFA World Cup Group J qualifier at Cardiff City Stadium. There was late drama when the teams met in Skopje in March, with Bojan Miovski giving the Macedonians the lead in the first minute of second-half stoppage time, but David Brooks making it 1-1 five minutes later. Another closely fought contest is expected this evening, with both teams battling it out for at least a place in the play-offs, but Wales will be expecting to make home advantage count this evening having won two of their previous matches in front of their own fans in the group, with the only blemish coming in a 4-2 defeat at the hands of Belgium

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: Two expeditions set out to climb to the summit of the worlds highest mountain. Both parties of mountaineers get caught in one of the fiercest snowstorms ever recorded, and face a desperate struggle to survive against the elements. Director Baltasar Kormakurs adventure based on a 1996 expeditition, co-written by Simon Beaufoy (The Full Monty). The all-star cast includes Jason Clarke, Josh Brolin, Jake Gyllenhaal and Keira Knightley

programme.title: Men of the Manosphere
programme.desc: James Blake enters the virtual world of manhood, often referred to as the manosphere, in search of status, wealth and relationships. He meets three young men who have turned to male social media influencers for guidance and instruction as they seek to better themselves and achieve success in different areas of their lives, both on and offline

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for a recent incarnation of Aston Martins Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and theres a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: Rahul Kohli explains how the human condition has destroyed the greatest invention weve ever known and how it will end up destroying us

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The Boiler Shop arts and performance space in Newcastle is the venue for the fourth heat, which sees comics Charlie Ashton, Murph, Zoe Cousin, Caira OConnor and Shugufta Choudhry battling it out to book their place in this years grand final in Bradford. Amy Gledhill hosts the proceedings and the judges for the night are Teesside local Phil Dunning, former winner Dan Tiernan and head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Christopher MacArthur-Boyd hosts the fifth heat at the Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow, where five acts take to the stage in front of a packed house and judges Daniel Foxx, Susie McCabe and Fatiha El-Ghorri. Ayo Adenekan, Alan Jay, Kate Dolan, Calum Frost and Joe da Costa perform five minute sets in hopes of earning a place in the final at the Alhambra Theatre in Bradford

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A look back at some of the most memorable staff and patient stories filmed since 2011 at Kings College Hospital and St Georges in south London - places where life, love and loss unfold every day. At St Georges, 22-month-old Daisy arrives by air ambulance after being kicked in the head by a horse. She has a fractured skull, a bruise on her brain and concussion. As surgeons plan their next move, Maggie, an 83-year-old with a lust for life, has suspected sepsis, and five-year-old Roman has a pencil lead stuck in his ear. His mum Annie says Roman is charming and affectionate but can also be a handful

With Petes wife Paulette and son Josh threatening to leave, can Gordon get through to him and save the business?

Elsewhere, one duo charges £60 a head for a supper club event, another opts for a rowdy bingo night and a rival team attempts to throw a high-end party in an upmarket nightclub. programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Queens, New York, where he meets a family torn apart by the stress of running failing Greek restaurant Kati Allo. Husband-and-wife owners Manny and Christine are on the brink of divorce, while their daughter Evelyn is caught in the middle and at her wits end

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: In Israel, a murder epidemic is devastating Arab-Israeli communities. Krishnan Guru-Murthy investigates why most of these killings go unsolved. With much focus on the conflict in Gaza and rising hostilities in the West Bank, Krishnan asks why hundreds of Arab-Israeli citizens are being murdered each year in Israel itself? Arab citizens make up one-fifth of Israels population, but nearly three-quarters of its murder victims. When Israeli-Jews are murdered around 75 percent of cases are solved, compared to around 15 percent when the victim is Arab-Israeli. Krishnan discovers Arab organised crime families tightening their grip on towns long neglected by the state. In some areas, residents say theyre living under gang rule and accuse Israels right-wing government of turning a blind eye to the killings. In the coastal town of Jisr az-Zarqa, Krishnan meets families mourning sons shot dead in the street and mothers who say the police never even came to take witness statements. He meets a former gangster who says weapons from Israels own police and army are being sold to criminals. While community figures and an opposition politician accuse the government of deliberately abandoning Arab citizens to lawlessness and fear, Israels police say its doing everything it can to stop the violence

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Chandler and Monica go to a fertility clinic for tests, but are embarrassed to encounter an old acquaintance. Ross helps Joey pretend to be intelligent to woo Charlie, even though he is attracted to her himself, and Rachel sneaks into a spa for a massage

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica and Chandler conduct an embarrassing interview with a potential sperm donor after learning they cannot conceive a baby naturally. Rachel reveals she still has feelings for Joey, but his current girlfriend overhears her confession, and Phoebe bumps into her old boyfriend David. Comedy, guest starring John Stamos and Hank Azaria

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Double bill. The gang visits Barbados to hear Ross address a convention, but Chandler manages to destroy the only copy of his keynote speech. Joey and Rachel impersonate pharmacists to infiltrate a medical conference offering free drinks, while Mike arrives unexpectedly and proposes to Phoebe

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One After Joey and Rachel Kiss
programme.desc: Rachel and Joey struggle to find the words to tell Ross about their kiss in Barbados, while Phoebe makes the alarming discovery that Mike has a girlfriend. Starring Jennifer Aniston, Matt LeBlanc and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Is Fine
programme.desc: Ross tries to put on a brave face and invites Joey and Rachel to dinner with him and Charlie, but gets drunk and makes an embarrassing scene. Frank Jr tries to talk Phoebe into taking care of one of the triplets, while Chandler and Monica learn more about adoption

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross goes to a spray-tanning salon, but his failure to follow the instructions leaves him with a complexion he was not looking for. Joey and Rachel prepare to sleep together for the first time, but the night proves more awkward than romantic. Guest starring Jennifer Coolidge

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica and Chandler decide to delay their trip to Vermont to celebrate Emmas first birthday, but the party takes an unexpected turn with the delivery of a risque birthday cake. Comedy, guest starring Elliott Gould

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Rachels Sister Babysits

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Greg Kinnear guest stars as Charlies Nobel Prize-winning old flame, who is overseeing a grant Ross desperately wants. programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Home Study
programme.desc: Ross discovers Rachel has an irrational fear of swings, while Phoebe and Mike argue about whether to give their wedding fund to charity. The Bings learn Joey had a one-night stand with the adoption worker handling their case, and worry he has ruined their chances

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Late Thanksgiving

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Birth Mother

programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, Bradley and Barney visit the Red River Gorge in Kentucky, before heading to the supposedly haunted Poasttown Elementary School in Middletown, Ohio. The next day, they travel to Louisville, birthplace of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali, where they follow in his footsteps by sparring at the local boxing gym. At the end of a long day, Barney rewards his dad with a well-earned meal at a KFC restaurant in Kentucky - the home state of the chains founder Colonel Harland Sanders

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The Chase presenter Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together. This time, the actor and his son arrive in Ohio, where they head for Dayton - the birthplace of aviation - before the pair attend a local rodeo later that evening. Brad soon realises that they are not just there to spectate on the sport, they are also expected to take part. However, a nasty fall from an angry bull means Brad spends the rest of the night in hospital

One-time ravers Jason and Jennifer host the final evening, hoping their travel-inspired menu and surprising revelations will help them secure the cash prize

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of the owners of Hannah and Masons, a French bistro in Cranbury, New Jersey. programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Ex water-skiing champion Hannah longs for a luxurious wedding day, but groom Tommy organises a ceremony at sea to celebrate his fiancees sporty past

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Dubliners Tracey and Peter have been together six years after meeting online. Tracey is the organiser, Peter is the complete opposite, a laidback scatterbrain whose only loves in life - apart from his bride-to-be - are their two-year-old son and football. Now he gets the chance to prove his worth, but it proves a rocky road to the big day, with advice from a naked stranger and a dodgy wedding veil before they get to the reception at - where else? - the sports club

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: While clearing up the loft, Dad finds his old, terrifying-looking ventriloquist dummy Lord Luck. Unfortunately Dad is a terrible ventriloquist, and it seems that Lord Luck only knows two words - ones not to be repeated in polite company. Meanwhile, Jonnys friend, Ben is coming for dinner. Hes recently been dumped by his fiancee and is in need of cheering up. Comedy, starring Simon Bird, Tom Rosenthal and Tamsin Greig

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: Adam brings his old violin back home, and as a special family treat Mum makes him agree to play the instrument for Grandma, who has been invited round for dinner. An amused Jonny relishes every moment of discomfort as he watches on from the sidelines. Simon Bird, Tom Rosenthal, Tamsin Greig, Paul Ritter and Frances Cuka star in Robert Poppers award-winning comedy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Sheldon stresses out about picking a wedding date, Amy tries to convince him that he has a more laid-back side. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart compete to win the heart of Bernadettes new colleague Ruchi. Swati Kapila guest stars

Finally, fun-loving couple Charlotte and Kevin put together a trendy Japanese menu, before the winners of the £1,000 prize money are revealed

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride

programme.desc: Leonard and Penny share an intimate moment as they recover from a psychological deconstruction by the physicists mother, an expert in psychiatry and neural sciences. Guest starring Mamma Mia! actress Christine Baranski

programme.desc: Tensions between Sheldon and Penny reach a new high after a paintballing accident leaves an ugly stain on the awkward physicists favourite sofa cushion. Meanwhile, romance blossoms between Leslie and Howard. Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon, Howard and Raj discover actress Summer Glau is on their train while travelling to San Francisco. Desperate to discuss the Terminator TV series with her, the friends devise a number of plans to engage her in conversation. With Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny starts her own hair accessories business and the orders start to pile in. However, she makes the mistake of asking Sheldon to help, leading to frustration and regret. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren offers Mercedes support following her recent loss. Frankies nervous about her date. And a mother is shaken when she sees the anger in her sons eyes

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The walls are closing in on Lucas, and Dodger struggles to hide his emotions at work. Dianes concerns grow over her childs behaviour

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos on the themes of food and animals

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yannis in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasnt allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peters family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, shes oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is down in the dumps, until Lisa wins him a hi-tech computer tablet in the school raffle - and it soon becomes impossible for him to put it down, as every waking minute he finds himself stroking or jabbing the shiny touchscreen. However, disaster strikes when he breaks the device, sending him spiralling back down into the depths of despair. But when Ned Flanders discovers the word Hope written on a tree trunk in the Simpsons garden, Homer believes it to be a miracle and his faith in life is restored - although newsman Kent Brockman isnt quite so convinced

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Day the Earth Stood Cool
programme.desc: Homer shakes off the shackles of his traditional lifestyle after hitting it off with his trendy new neighbours, who are the ultimate in cool - although Marge isnt too keen on the hipster clan, especially their parenting style. However, when Bart falls out with one of his new friends kids, the doughnut-loving dad soon sees them for what they really are. With the guest voices of Portlandia stars Fred Armisen and Carrie Brownstein, and Patton Oswalt (Young Adult)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After more than five years of dating, Sheldon and Amy spend their first night together, while Leonard, Howard and Raj must decide who will take their extra Star Wars movie ticket. Plus, Sheldons Obi-Wan advises him on his difficult relationship decisions. Starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with recurring guest star Bob Newhart

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet a psychiatrist on her behalf, while Sheldon and Raj collaborate on an astronomical discovery. Stuart moves out, but Howard and Bernadettes happiness is short-lived. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay is troubled when best pal Shorty reveals that he and his wife are moving away. Phil and Claire take Haley out to discuss her future, while Mitchell and Cam take a break from all the wedding planning to enjoy a romantic meal - only to interrupt a couples surprise engagement dinner. Chazz Palminteri and Jennifer Tilly guest star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire thinks Luke is up to no good with his friends, so she persuades a reluctant Phil into helping her spy on their son. Gloria is suspicious of Jay when he starts moaning amorously in his sleep and Mitch struggles to keep a secret from Cam

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny finds out Leonards family never celebrated his birthdays, so she enlists Sheldons help to organise a surprise party, while Howard gets him out of the way by staging an emergency hospital visit. Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Following the break-up of Pennys relationship, Leonard finally summons up the courage to ask her out. When she accepts, they both turn to Sheldon for advice on how to handle the forthcoming date. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon finds himself forced to keep a secret when Penny decides to tell him what happened on her disappointing first date with Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is dejected to see Penny with another man and decides to cut his losses by going back to fellow scientist Leslie Winkle - a move that upsets Sheldon. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Sara Gilbert

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Meemaw comes to babysit when Sheldons dad is rushed to the emergency room, but while she is sleeping the kids borrow their grandmothers car and make their own way to hospital

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Therapist, a Comic Book and a Breakfast Sausage
programme.desc: The youngster fears solid food after choking on a sausage, and also discovers his first comic book. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns attempts to fulfil his lifelong ambition of becoming a superhero and take down a rogues gallery of familiar faces, but devoted sidekick Smithers secretly intervenes after noticing his boss isnt quite up to the challenge. Lisa steps in as Barts attorney when he is falsely accused of pulling an Easter prank

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is recruited to be a church deacon by the trendy new reverend - but when he starts to embrace the faith a little too seriously, Bart asks Flanders to help him track down their former pastor, the Rev Lovejoy. Meanwhile, the dry cleaners mistakenly swap Marges wedding dress for one of Krustys clown costumes. With the guest voice of Edward Norton

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny feels threatened when a sexy actress, who has landed a role in TV series CSI, moves into the apartment building, and gradually begins to sense that her friends are being manipulated by the new arrival. Comedy, starring Kaley Cuoco, Valerie Azlynn, Johnny Galecki and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny catches the eye of comic-book shopkeeper Stuart, and Leonard is devastated when she gives serious consideration to dating her new admirer. Desperate for help, Leonard enlists Sheldon to discredit his love rival by preying on his obsession with Batman. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Kevin Sussman star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Stuart takes Penny out for a second date, during which she drunkenly reveals her true feelings. Meanwhile, Howard uncovers a flaw in the toilet he designed for a Nasa space shuttle, and asks his friends to help him correct it before the launch. Kaley Cuoco, Kevin Sussman and Simon Helberg star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon wins a grant to pay for a summer expedition to the North Pole, and invites his friends to join him. However, the gangs imminent departure causes Leonard and Penny to reconsider their feelings for each other. Johnny Gale and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes a union representative at the power plant and immediately uses his new-found authority to save the companys free dental plan and avoid having to pay for Lisas new braces. Featuring the voice of Dr Joyce Brothers

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: So Its Come to This: A Simpsons Clip Show
programme.desc: Barts latest prank wrecks the house and lands Homer in hospital, where he and the family reminisce about all the other injuries and mishaps he has suffered in his eventful and disaster-filled life

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Diane is shocked by what she finds on her sons phone, Dodger confides in Donny and a family is torn apart

programme.title: Animal Control
programme.desc: Shred is on the rebound, but Frank doesnt share his newfound enthusiasm for dating. Emily enlists the teams help beating Templetons precinct in an animal adoption competition

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: The remaining girls face two crucial challenges in the final to decide who will be crowned the winner. They take part in a CoverGirl shoot and are dressed by guest judge designer Roberto Cavalli for a catwalk show

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Hunted, Bake Off: The Professionals, Made in Chelsea, Love in the Jungle, Top of the Pops 1992, Dickinsons Real Deal, Britains Got Talent, and BBC News coverage of the Prime Ministers apparent involvement in Partygate

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Professional singer Precious seeks romance with amateur magician Earle. The restaurant also welcomes company director John, who hopes fellow Scot Greig is the man he can settle down with. And fellow diner Hebe is on the verge of giving up on finding Mr Right. Hopefully she will connect with fine wine merchant Charles

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.sub-title: Best Naughty Bits: Breaking Nude Ground
programme.desc: A look back at the times that the unique dating show has broken new ground, featuring stories from across the spectrum of gender and sexuality. There is also a catch-up with Lauren Harries, celebrated transsexual woman and the first celebrity to appear in a pod, and Josh, who was on the third series, to find out if he is still a virgin

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon hires an attractive female assistant, but when she becomes interested in Leonard, Penny decides to mark her territory by sleeping with him. Meanwhile, Howard starts to lose his mind when his return from space is delayed another week. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard returns from his space mission, but the welcome from his friends and family does not meet his expectations. His night alone with Bernadette goes badly, his mother ignores him, and he realises Stuart has taken his place as Rajs best friend. On top of that, Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny kick him out of their group games night. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Hunted, Bake Off: The Professionals, Made in Chelsea, Love in the Jungle, Top of the Pops 1992, Dickinsons Real Deal, Britains Got Talent, and BBC News coverage of the Prime Ministers apparent involvement in Partygate

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the concluding part of his trip to the Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, Gordons disagreement with proprietor Joe Nagy erupts into one of his most intense confrontations yet. Just when it looks like he has turned the corner and is ready to accept help, Joe slips back into his old ways, denying his own failings and picking petty fights. Can Gordon get this stubborn owner to finally accept his advice and secure the future of his restaurant?

programme.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
programme.desc: A woman trapped in a loveless marriage to the future king of England falls for an aristocrat romantically linked to a possessive countess. Period drama, starring Stewart Granger, Joan Greenwood, Francoise Rosay and Flora Robson

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: A Belgian priest living in exile in Britain during the Second World War becomes a secret agent for the Allies, but his first mission is a disaster, leading to the capture of a resistance leader. Four soldiers are sent into occupied France to rescue the insurgent, but begin to realise they have a traitor in their midst. Thriller, starring Jack Warner and Simone Signoret

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When works of art start disappearing, stolen by a master thief, Father Brown attempts to catch the culprit and save his soul. Comedy drama, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood and Peter Finch

programme.title: Tolkien
programme.desc: Before going on to write classic fantasy books The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings, orphaned author JRR Tolkien finds friendship, love and artistic inspiration among a group of fellow outcasts at school. Eventually his experiences during the First World War inspire him to create a world of hobbits and wizards. Biopic, starring Nicholas Hoult, Lily Collins, Pam Ferris, Craig Roberts, and Derek Jacobi

programme.title: Men in Black: International
programme.desc: The intergalactic law enforcers have always protected the Earth from the scum of the universe. This time they tackle their biggest threat - a mole in the Men in Black organisation. Director F Gary Grays fantasy sequel, starring Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Rebecca Ferguson

programme.title: Vesper
programme.desc: Thirteen-year-old Vesper and her paralysed father struggle to survive on the desolate outskirts of a gated city, until they meet a mysterious woman who promises to change their lives. Sci-fi adventure, starring Raffiella Chapman, Eddie Marsan, Rosy McEwan and Richard Brake

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: A rancher seizes the chance to settle his debts and earn his sons respect by agreeing to escort a notorious outlaw to the town of Contention, where a train will take the prisoner to jail. But the journey takes a dangerous turn when the criminal tries to manipulate the rancher into letting him go - while his henchmen lie in wait. Western remake, starring Russell Crowe, Christian Bale and Gretchen Mol

programme.title: Amanda
programme.desc: A young man takes on the responsibility of raising his seven-year-old niece Amanda, after his sister is killed in a terrorist attack on Paris. Mikhaël Herss drama, starring Vincent Lacoste and Isaure Multrier. In French

programme.title: Young Winston
programme.desc: Biopic of Winston Churchill, following the future prime ministers formative years. While working as a journalist, he travels to Africa to report on the Boer Wars, an assignment that leads to his incarceration in a prison camp. He escapes from captivity and returns to England to begin a political career. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft and Robert Shaw

programme.title: Time Lock
programme.desc: A boy manages to get himself locked in a bank vault. With 63 hours before the device opens, the authorities are left facing a race against time to free the lad before he runs out of air. Thriller, starring Robert Beatty, Betty McDowall, Vincent Winter, Lee Patterson and a young Sean Connery in an early role

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: Oscar-winning Second World War biopic of the American general admired for his brilliant tactical skills and ability to inspire his men to great things. But this complex man was equally noted for his abrasive temper, egotism and consuming sense of rivalry, which so antagonised his superiors he was eventually relieved of his command. Starring George C Scott, Karl Malden, Michael Bates and Stephen Young

programme.title: Instant Family
programme.desc: After being taunted by relatives who think they will never have kids, married couple Pete and Ellie Wagner consider the option of adopting a child. However, they get more than they bargained for when they take in a rebellious teen and her two siblings. Director Sean Anders comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg, Rose Byrne and Isabela Merced

programme.title: The Artifice Girl
programme.desc: Special agents create a revolutionary AI system to catch internet child predators, but disaster looms when it develops quicker than intended. Sci-fi mystery, starring Tatum Matthews, Lance Henriksen, Sinda Nichols and David Girard

programme.title: Alita: Battle Angel
programme.desc: In the 26th century, dismantled cyborg Alita is repaired by Dr Dyson Ido, a kindly technician with a dark secret. As she falls in love with local youth Hugo, the truth behind her mysterious past is eventually revealed. Director Robert Rodriguezs sci-fi adventure based on the manga comic, starring Rosa Salazar, Christoph Waltz and Jennifer Connelly

programme.title: Hilary and Jackie
programme.desc: Biopic of world-famous cellist Jacqueline du Pre, focusing on her relationship with sister Hilary and following her torrid affair with her brother-in-law, her tumultuous personal life and the battle against multiple sclerosis that threatened to end her career. Starring Emily Watson, Rachel Griffiths, James Frain and David Morrissey

Ant and Dec present highlights from the past 24 hours as the celebrities get used to life without home comforts, and the pressure of getting enough stars to keep fellow contestants fed weighs heavily on those put forward for tasks

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
programme.desc: The young wizard and his friends return for their second term at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry to discover a strange serpentine power is petrifying the other students. As if that were not bad enough, Harry is haunted by a sinister voice in his head urging him to uncover the dark force that is stalking the corridors of the school. Can new Dark Arts teacher Gilderoy Lockhart, a wizard well known for battling all manner of magical creatures, help uncover the mystery? Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson and Kenneth Branagh

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian gets a job with prestigious magazine The New Yorker, but it is not long before his new employer discovers he did not graduate from college, and promptly fires him. Filled with a burning desire to vindicate himself, he resolves to finish his education

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan takes Steve to the barbershop to mingle with his circle of friends, but the meeting ends with Stan, Steve and Tuttle on the run from the Mafia after Stan lets it slip that Tuttle is in the witness protection programme

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: When Stan realises that he cannot cry, he asks Steve to teach him how to show empathy

programme.title: Plebs
programme.desc: Grumio falls ill after eating an apple while on the toilet, but Marcus refuses to pay for his medical treatment - preferring instead to go with Cynthias remedy of candlelight and prayer. Meanwhile, Stylax strikes up a rapport with rich nobleman Gaius, who agrees to fund his career in chariot racing. Comedy, guest starring James Fleet (The Vicar of Dibley)

programme.desc: Mr Middleditch makes a surprise announcement on his birthday that causes an argument between Weatherill and Ormerod, but the celebrations are interrupted when a bus full of day-trippers plunges down a nearby embankment. Rural drama starring Ian Carmichael, Robert Cavanagh and co-starring Gareth Hale

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Nicola seduces David and Jasmine wonders if he was faithful when they were together. Chas and Lexi sell their bionic bears and Katie and Gray grow closer.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rosemarys car is found abandoned near Manor Farm and Matthew is taken in for questioning. Katie lets Jonny in on her secret, while Chas and Lexi are quizzed about the bears.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ashley grows increasingly anxious as Casey continues to stalk him, Norris takes a bemused Rita for lunch and pops the question, while Roy worries about Hayleys state of mind.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: A deranged Casey kidnaps Freddie and locks him on her balcony in his pram, warning Ashley she wont release his son until he talks to her. Eileen and Jerry make a date.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: After having his career scrutinised by the General Medical Council because of his blood phobia, Martin makes efforts to overcome his fear and begins to question whether he made the right decision about resigning. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: With Susie and Carnegies relationship the talk of the hospital, Matron reaches the end of her tether when her niece turns up late for work and she decides to suspend her. Mr Rose faces a personal trial when his golfing friend ends up in the operating room and Dr Burnett wrestles with a dilemma. Ormerod and Bobby try to rescue a farmer who is trapped under a combine harvester. Starring Sarah Beck Mather, Wendy Craig and Damian OHare

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jennys younger brother Steve pays a visit, and soon begins to threaten her relationship with Merton. Meanwhile, David sets his sights on joining a mod gang causing havoc in the village. Sarah Tansey, Thom Fell, Maureen OBrien and Robert East star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress thinks Mikes replacement PC Steve Crane is too anxious to prove his worth as he investigates a spate of farm break-ins on the moors, and Vernon causes chaos trying to impress new arrival Dr Liz Merrick with his community spirit. Elsewhere, Mike grows disillusioned with CID work. James Carlton and Aislin McGuckin star as the newcomers

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Matthew becomes convinced he is being framed for Rosemarys disappearance. Emily holds leaving drinks at the Woolpack and Gray begs Jonny not to reveal his sexuality to Katie.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Gray locates Rosemary and discovers shes plotting revenge on Matthew. Ashley and Laurel panic when they realise their children are missing and Paul tells Nicola hes leaving.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ashley is forced to confess to having an affair as a horrified Claire finds Casey threatening to jump off her balcony with Freddie. Kayleigh scuppers Jerrys date with Eileen.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: News spreads round the Street of the previous days dramatic events. Ashley struggles to come to terms with his situation and Claire berates Audrey for keeping her in the dark.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Secrets could be exposed as Rosamund arrives at Downton following Ediths shock departure. Rose is delighted to introduce Atticus and his parents to the Abbey, while Anna and Bates start thinking about a fresh start, now that the worst of their problems are seemingly behind them. Molesley is concerned to see Daisy becoming disillusioned with her studies, and Isobel makes a happy announcement, but there may be trouble on the horizon. Violet has her hands full with her warring servants, while Mary and Blake seize an opportunity to send Gillingham a strong message

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The surgery is chaotic, with both Martin and Louisa now practising from it. Berts new business venture with Al doesnt get off to a good start, and Penhale suspects noise complaints are due to paranormal activity. Drama, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who is forced to retrain as a GP and takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village, where he soon finds himself at odds with the locals

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An informant reveals two local hoodlums are planning to raid a shipment of gold bullion from Haworth Point, prompting Shiner to set up an ambush to catch the would-be thieves. Gina receives a visit from her niece, who has fallen in with a bad crowd back in Manchester, while Liz enlists David to paint the surgery and sitting room - but is less than pleased with the results. Drama, starring Simon Molloy and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A clairvoyant at Whitby Funfair gives a bride-to-be cold feet about her imminent nuptials. Meanwhile, Bellamy is persuaded to cover at the pub, and is almost caught serving drinks after hours, while a new policeman in the village is suspected of being an imposter. Rural drama, starring Ruth Platt, Robert Hands, Mark Jordan and Craig Heaney

programme.title: Rosemary and Thyme
programme.desc: Horticultural lecturer Rosemary Boxer is hired by a wealthy but ill businessman to help cure a disease causing his trees to lose their bark. She gets to know Laura Thyme, who turns up after a friend is killed in a suspicious car accident, and when the pair find the lord of the manor unconscious beneath his bedroom window, they must decide whether depression led him to attempt suicide or if there is a more sinister explanation. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal, Pam Ferris, David Mallinson and Roger Alborough

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.sub-title: The Wolf Hunter of Little Worthy
programme.desc: A local photographer wins an urban myth competition with his creation of the legend of the Wolf Hunter, and the tall tale unexpectedly gains a cult following. However, when a man is killed, Barnaby and Winter must investigate if this myth has become murderous reality

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A middle-aged Oxford graduate is found murdered, setting in motion an investigation that leads Lewis and Hathaway to one of the universitys most senior dons, whose respectable exterior conceals a strange past. Before long a second death occurs, and it becomes apparent that both victims shared a secret - and that someone is out for revenge. Starring Kevin Whately, Laurence Fox, Anna Massey, Clare Holman and Sian Thomas

programme.desc: David reacts to Gails tough stance by packing his bags and leaving home, while Ashley fears hes lost Claire for good. Sean meets a potential date at the hospital.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Preparations are under way for Roses wedding, but family tensions on both sides threaten to derail proceedings. Ediths arrangement with Marigold is happily working out, but how long can she and Cora conceal the truth from Robert? Denker reveals an unexpected side to her personality, which causes trouble for more than one of the servants. With the war memorial due to be unveiled, Mrs Patmore is still upset, but Robert has something up his sleeve. Branson comes to a heart-wrenching decision, and the storm clouds that have been gathering over Anna and Bates finally burst

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.sub-title: How Long Has This Been Going On?
programme.desc: Morwenna is back as receptionist and the Ellinghams have a new dog. Martin attends Stewarts survival course, but not as a participant like Al and Penhale. Louisa agrees to help Pippa by speaking at the school assembly alongside Mrs Tishell. Drama, starring Martin Clunes as a surgeon who is forced to retrain as a GP and takes up a post in a sleepy Cornish village where he soon finds himself at odds with the locals

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lizs past catches up with her, and Vernons dreams of wealth go up in smoke. Meanwhile, Merton receives crime-fighting assistance from an unlikely source - two locals dressed as Batman and Robin, who have spotted criminal activity on a derelict farm

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A mysterious marksman sharpens up his sniper skills on a flock of unsuspecting sheep, before heading for Aidensfield and murdering Lizs ex-boyfriend, a newly arrived doctor. While she attempts to comfort the victims bereaved spouse, Bellamy is shot in the arm and sets out in pursuit of the rifle-toting villain. Drama, with Jason Durr making his final appearance as Mike Bradley

programme.title: Rosemary and Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths uncover the remains of a racehorse while engaged on horticultural work in the grounds of pop star Nev Connollys supposedly haunted mansion. Before long, gruesome revelations are coming thick and fast as Nev is shot dead and more bones are discovered - this time belonging to a young woman. As they investigate further, Rosemary and Laura are plunged into a sinister mystery with roots deep in the past. Drama, guest starring Murray Head (Heartbeat) and Abigail Cruttenden (Benidorm)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Cleaner Luke Sumners body is discovered close to his flat in Newcastle, but pathology concludes that the killing blow could have occurred several hours before he succumbed to his injuries, prompting Vera to piece together the victims final hours in order to investigate his murder. But Luke lived a simple life and had even severed all ties to the quaint rural village where he grew up - including his mother Carmel. Can she shed any light on her sons murder?

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective suspects a connection between the death of a student with secret plans for advancement and the killing of well-known criminal Nicky Turnbull, who was in Oxford to speak at the Union. As Lewis and Hathaway eliminate suspects from a long list of the crooks enemies, the investigation brings him into contact with old flame Diane - who also happens to be Turnbulls wife. Kevin Whately stars, with Laurence Fox and Gina McKee

programme.desc: The girls discover that a dud racehorse has been switched with a champion so a syndicate can clean up on a big race _ and the gamblers are prepared to kill to protect their devious scheme. Jaclyn Smith and Kate Jackson star

Crime thriller, starring Robert De Niro, Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Dave Bautista and Kate Bosworth.

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Belinda and Lee clash over the lighting for their gallery space, Tim gets creative with Sashas bamboo tunnel and Stephanie plans to transform a fishing pond into a swimming pool

With their combined skills, the pair made a great start but when things start to slow down, their decision to go against presenter Simon OBriens advice proves costly

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Simon OBrien, Tayo Oguntonade and Carys Davies buy two strangers a house at auction and give them a renovation budget and just months to flip it. Communications worker Llyr and kitchen designer Elinor team up to renovate a run-down terraced house in Tonypandy, south Wales, with just six months to turn a profit

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Communications director Kath and graphic designer Charlotte from east London cannot wait to escape their busy city lives by buying a Spanish holiday home around the stunning mountains of Sierra Nevada, where its possible to sunbathe on the beach and go skiing, all in the same day. Danni Menzies finds five options for their £120,000 budget, but will any wow them enough to want to put in an offer?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Nurse Karen and GP Alastair from Montrose long for a slower pace of life and are relocating to the beautiful countryside of the Dordogne in France. They want a character property with a pool, thats also big enough for their whole family to come and visit. Laura Hamilton shows them five options for their £175,000 budget

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the Manchester area, 27-year-old full-time mum Johanna, plans an evening dedicated to takeways from Turkey to China and India. Her guests are 34-year-old lorry driver Ryan, 48-year-old housewife Fiona, 45-year-old laundrette owner Linzi and 53-year-old translator Nico, on a night that includes a sojourn into Shakespeare

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Manchester, lorry-driving movie buff Ryan plans a film-inspired menu including his Prawn Identity starter, Sausage Meat the Fockers and Chocolate Clockwork Orange desert. Unfortunately the first course is more of a disaster movie for Johanna, who has to face her fear of prawns. Meanwhile, Nico puts the cat among the pigeons with his views on male chefs and Fiona takes Linzi to task over her beauty regime

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous domestic delegator Fiona aims to impress with a classy but effortless menu as she hosts the third dinner party of the week in the Manchester area. However, critical Linzi takes issue with Fionas mother chopping her vegetables and her cousin making her honeycomb. Then, theres more trouble brewing as Nico and Johanna clash

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Critical laundrette owner Linzi has been a hard taskmaster all week in the Manchester area, so expects to show her guests where theyve been going wrong. Shes not pleased when Ryan questions her choice of starter. When the guests find out what Linzi does for a job, Nico struggles to understand the concept of a laundrette. Self-proclaimed domestic delegator Fiona has to face her fears during Linzis entertainment - an ironing competition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in the Manchester area, Nico plans to show the Brits how its done in the kitchen with his Italian cooking. Hes been talking up his Italian heritage all week, and Linzis convinced hes heading for a fall. Ryans shocked by some of Nicos locker-room tales, while baby of the group Johanna horrifies the other female contestants with her thoughts on gender politics. It remains to be seen who will pick up the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first destination is North Kingsfield Holiday Cottages in East Yorkshire, where a revelation over evening drinks leaves the guests all at sea

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Crackin View Guest House in Northumberland. Owners Steve and Maria Turnbull reckon their scenic vista and homespun appeal will pip their rivals to the post

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rivals arrive at the Domo Boutique Hotel in Oldbury near Birmingham, where owner Ali expects his luxury lodgings to wow his fellow competitors. Helen and Lauren are dazzled by the decor, but a caffeine conundrum leads to some trouble brewing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guest house owners convene at the Crown Inn in Gayton, Norfolk, where owners Lisa and Neil Staples hope their historic setting and boutique-style rooms will garner praise. Once theyve checked in, Helen and Lauren make a critical observation about the cleanliness of the windows, while Ali and Serge are left feeling exposed in the bathroom. On a buggy ride across a wildlife reserve, the rivalry spills over into some raucous racing - but at drinks, its Neils chat-up lines that veer off track

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts meet one last time to settle scores and discover what theyve been paid. First up is Helen Milner, and her daughter Lauren, but although they asked one pair to close off their curtain comments, its a surprising set of payments which leave them open-mouthed. Another host addresses why his guests werent full of beans - only for one pair to express some strong opinions about his breakfast. Off-colour feedback about one BandBs bedding leads to more frank exchanges. The guests dramatic discoveries surface, before the payments are revealed and the winner is finally announced

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Back in 2011, Edward and Hazel Short set out to build an art deco, shining white lighthouse tower with additional bedrooms, guest rooms and infinity pool, all on a rugged but beautiful clifftop in north Devon. It was an ambitious project and quickly ran into problems, not least of which were the apparent breakdown of the couples marriage and a spiral of borrowing and debt, leaving Edward facing bankruptcy. Kevin McCloud now returns to see if anything has been salvaged from this disastrous project

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A 77-year-old former motorbike racer arrives with a potentially deadly swelling of the main artery that could burst at any moment. His only option is major surgery, which could be dangerous at his age. A woman whose boyfriend was killed in a cycling accident a year previously is also injured while on her bike, and a medical technician and a mobile caterer talk about their roles in aiding people to recovery

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics attend a suspected domestic assault and need to treat one man who claims he was punched and knocked unconscious. A rare genetic disease leaves a woman with a dislocated shoulder and in excruciating pain, and a man, who in the past has threatened the emergency services with a weapon, calls for an ambulance

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The East Anglian Air Ambulance crew fight to save their patients partially amputated hand in Stowmarket and a crew in High Wycombe to help a man in cardiac arrest. The Essex and Herts Air Ambulance team deal with Beckys badly broken ankle in Chelmsford and in Hatfield, a motorcyclist suffers multiple injuries after a collision with a van

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Air ambulance crews respond to headteacher Andy who has collapsed after a cardiac arrest in Essex and warehouse employee Rob who is trapped under a pallet of granite in Ipswich. Katie, who is 13-weeks pregnant, calls for help when she keeps having seizures and the Essex and Herts Air Ambulance crew help Jo who has been lying on the bathroom floor with a broken ankle for nine hours

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A 77-year-old former motorbike racer arrives with a potentially deadly swelling of the main artery that could burst at any moment. His only option is major surgery, which could be dangerous at his age. A woman whose boyfriend was killed in a cycling accident a year previously is also injured while on her bike, and a medical technician and a mobile caterer talk about their roles in aiding people to recovery

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: The medical team faces a range of sport and drink-related injuries on a busy Saturday, including two women hurt when the bar they were dancing on collapsed, and a bricklayer badly cut in an attempted mugging. The nights most dramatic case occurs when a father and son are brought in with life-threatening injuries after being attacked by gatecrashers at a family birthday party, one of whom was armed with a samurai sword

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty determines whether brioche is bread or cake and why it has become the preferred choice for burgers, and Matt Tebbutt is on a mission to find out why wine comes in bottles of so many different shapes and sizes. Kate Quilton gets to the bottom of why some ice-creams melt faster than others

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: The discovery of an old postcard inspires Janet and Philip to rebuild a lost turret. Donna and Paul think laterally when they decide to reinstate a statement window

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Questions are raised in the south of France when mortar refuses to set during Janet and Philips ambitious turret project. At Chateau Lagorce, Anna and Edward hope to make the dream of their six-year-old son Charles a reality when they try to build a tree house on a grand scale. Plus, Ben and Billies ballroom restoration project reaches the decoration stage - meaning Billie must face to her fear of heights to paint the ceiling

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Simon OBrien, Tayo Oguntonade and Carys Davies buy two strangers a house at auction and give them a renovation budget and just months to flip it.
