programme.desc: After discovering a plot to haul stolen cattle in the middle of nowhere, a desperate and isolated lawman becomes the only person standing between lethal rustlers and a clear run to the border. Thriller, starring Lochlyn Munro

programme.title: Y2K
programme.desc: Two buddies sneak into a party on New Years Eve 1999, but the night turns even crazier as the clock hits midnight. Director Kyle Mooneys teen horror comedy, starring Jaeden Martell, Rachel Zegler and Julian Dennison

programme.title: My Dead Friend Zoe
programme.desc: An Afghanistan veteran comes head to head with her Vietnam vet grandfather at the familys lake house. Comedy drama, starring Sonequa Martin-Green (The Walking Dead), Natalie Morales and Ed Harris

programme.title: A Newport Christmas
programme.desc: A charitable and spirited Newport socialite in 1905 dreams of using her cash to start a foundation to help others in town. Romantic drama, starring Wes Brown and Ginna Claire Mason

programme.title: Escape from the 21st Century
programme.desc: In 1999, after discovering they have the power to travel in time with every sneeze, three friends embark on an adventure to save the world. Fantasy adventure, starring Ruoyun Zhang and Elane Zhong. In Chinese and Mandarin, with English subtitles

programme.title: Johnny Mnemonic
programme.desc: A courier transports information in a microchip in his brain. On his latest assignment, he is pursued by various criminal, militant and corporate factions who will kill to get the data - and he only has 24 hours to deliver it before it destroys his mind. Sci-fi thriller based on a William Gibson short story, starring Keanu Reeves, Dolph Lundgren and Ice-T

programme.title: 57 Seconds
programme.desc: Franklin, a blogger, scuppers an attack against tech guru Anton Burrell, and finds a ring that the pioneering genius dropped. The device gives its wearer the ability to travel 57 seconds into the past, so Franklin decides to use it to take revenge against the pharmaceutical company responsible for his sisters death. Thriller, starring Josh Hutcherson and Morgan Freeman

A scientist learns the world is soon to face a global cataclysm that will wipe out the human race, but finds the US president has plans to secretly save a fraction of the population, leaving everyone else to die. A writer learns of this scheme, and as the world is devastated by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, he tries to get his family to the last safe refuge. Disaster epic, starring John Cusack and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Escape from the 21st Century
programme.desc: In 1999, after discovering they have the power to travel in time with every sneeze, three friends embark on an adventure to save the world. Fantasy adventure, starring Ruoyun Zhang and Elane Zhong. In Chinese and Mandarin, with English subtitles

programme.title: Dual
programme.desc: A woman named Sarah opts for a cloning procedure after she receives a terminal diagnosis. She unexpectedly recovers, but her attempts to have the clone decommissioned fail, leading to a court-mandated battle to the death. Sci-fi thriller, starring Karen Gillan and Aaron Paul

programme.title: Resident Evil: Afterlife
programme.desc: Zombie-fighting heroine Alice roams the post-apocalyptic wasteland searching for human survivors. An encounter with an old friend leads her to a rumoured sanctuary in Los Angeles, but she discovers she has walked into a deadly trap and must once again battle the hordes of the living dead. Action horror sequel, starring Milla Jovovich, Ali Larter and Wentworth Miller

programme.title: Zombieland: Double Tap
programme.desc: A decade after they joined forces, survivors Tallahassee, Columbus, Wichita and Little Rock have become experts in identifying and disposing assorted zombies. They set up their new home in the abandoned White House, but after Little Rock heads to Graceland, the team attempts to save her from a group of super zombies. Director Ruben Fleischers comedy horror sequel, starring Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg and Emma Stone

programme.title: Gothika
programme.desc: A psychiatrist wakes to find herself confined in the mental hospital where she once worked, accused of her husbands murder. Just when she thinks her situation could not get any worse, the spirit of a dead teenager begins to haunt her. Psychological horror, starring Halle Berry, Robert Downey Jr, Penelope Cruz and Bernard Hill

programme.title: Strange Darling
programme.desc: A twisted one-night stand devolves into a serial killers vicious killing spree and a cat-and-mouse chase. Writer/director JT Mollners thriller, starring Willa Fitzgerald, Kyle Gallner, Madisen Beaty and Barbara Hershey

programme.title: Heart Eyes
programme.desc: When two co-workers survive a killer on Valentines Day, the two have to find out who it is. Comedy horror, starring Mason Gooding, Olivia Holt and Gigi Zumbado

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: A team of commandos enters a top-secret underground research facility when a deadly virus which turns victims into flesh-eating zombies is accidentally released. But their containment mission spins out of control as a rogue super-intelligent computer and hordes of the marauding undead wreak havoc. Sci-fi action horror, starring Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez and James Purefoy

programme.title: Resident Evil: Extinction
programme.desc: Zombie-fighting heroine Alice comes out of hiding to protect a group of refugees in a post-apocalyptic wasteland overrun by the walking dead. Meanwhile, the sinister corporation that created the zombie virus is about to embark on its most dangerous experiment yet. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Milla Jovovich, Oded Fehr and Ali Larter

programme.title: Resident Evil: Apocalypse
programme.desc: Zombie-fighting heroine Alice must battle her way through an entire city of the living dead in search of the scientist who created the zombie virus, in the hope of finding a way to stop it spreading further. Meanwhile, the corporation that employed him unleashes the product of its latest deadly genetic experiment on the city. Sci-fi horror sequel, starring Milla Jovovich and Sienna Guillory

programme.title: Dual
programme.desc: A woman named Sarah opts for a cloning procedure after she receives a terminal diagnosis. She unexpectedly recovers, but her attempts to have the clone decommissioned fail, leading to a court-mandated battle to the death. Sci-fi thriller, starring Karen Gillan and Aaron Paul

programme.title: Zombieland: Double Tap
programme.desc: A decade after they joined forces, survivors Tallahassee, Columbus, Wichita and Little Rock have become experts in identifying and disposing assorted zombies. They set up their new home in the abandoned White House, but after Little Rock heads to Graceland, the team attempts to save her from a group of super zombies. Director Ruben Fleischers comedy horror sequel, starring Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg and Emma Stone

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: A team of commandos enters a top-secret underground research facility when a deadly virus which turns victims into flesh-eating zombies is accidentally released. But their containment mission spins out of control as a rogue super-intelligent computer and hordes of the marauding undead wreak havoc. Sci-fi action horror, starring Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez and James Purefoy

programme.title: Resident Evil: Afterlife
programme.desc: Zombie-fighting heroine Alice roams the post-apocalyptic wasteland searching for human survivors. An encounter with an old friend leads her to a rumoured sanctuary in Los Angeles, but she discovers she has walked into a deadly trap and must once again battle the hordes of the living dead. Action horror sequel, starring Milla Jovovich, Ali Larter and Wentworth Miller

programme.title: Gothika
programme.desc: A psychiatrist wakes to find herself confined in the mental hospital where she once worked, accused of her husbands murder. Just when she thinks her situation could not get any worse, the spirit of a dead teenager begins to haunt her. Psychological horror, starring Halle Berry, Robert Downey Jr, Penelope Cruz and Bernard Hill

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A journalist investigates several teenage deaths, which are linked to a cursed videotape and the rumour that anyone who watches it will die a week later. Her growing obsession with the tape endangers herself and her family - and to avoid the predicted fate, she has just seven days to find out where the recording came from. Gore Verbinskis remake of the Japanese supernatural horror, starring Naomi Watts, Martin Henderson and Brian Cox

programme.title: The Ring 2
programme.desc: Journalist Rachel Keller and her son try to rebuild their shattered lives, moving from Seattle to Oregon and starting afresh. However, the vengeful spirit of Samara follows, and this time she is determined to destroy them. Sequel to the horror remake, starring Naomi Watts, Simon Baker and David Dorfman, and featuring a cameo appearance from Sissy Spacek

programme.title: Event Horizon
programme.desc: A deep-space salvage crew investigate mysterious events aboard a hi-tech spaceship, which suddenly reappeared in orbit around Neptune after going missing for seven years - but it is not long before they are exposed to terror beyond their wildest nightmares. Sci-fi horror, starring Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: The Invisible Man
programme.desc: An abused woman flees for her life and takes refuge with a family. It later appears that Cecilia Kasss ex has killed himself and shes due to inherit a fortune, but the fact he was experimenting with an invisibility suit makes her think hes come after her. Thriller, starring Elisabeth Moss, Oliver Jackson-Cohen and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: 28 Days Later
programme.desc: A man wakes from a coma to discover Britain has been struck by a terrifying experimental virus that sends victims into a homicidal rage. With a handful of other survivors, he heads for Manchester, the last outpost unaffected by the outbreak - but realises the virus is not the only threat. Danny Boyles horror, starring Cillian Murphy, Naomie Harris, Brendan Gleeson and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: To Catch a Thief
programme.desc: A retired cat burglar becomes the prime suspect for a series of robberies carried out in his own distinctive style, and sets out to clear his name by catching the copycat crook responsible. His quest takes him to the Cote dAzur, where he encounters the demure daughter of a wealthy holiday-maker, and before long the two are drawn together. Alfred Hitchcocks romantic mystery, starring Cary Grant, Grace Kelly and Jessie Royce Landis

programme.title: Sharp Corner
programme.desc: Josh McCall is a family man who becomes obsessed with saving the lives of the car accident victims on the sharp corner in front of his house. Its an obsession that could cost him everything. Writer/director Jason Buxtons thriller, starring Ben Foster, Cobie Smulders and Gavin Drea

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: A CIA analyst gets caught up in the Colombian drug trade while trying to track down terrorists responsible for the murder of a close friend of the US president - but his investigations point to illegal activity and corruption at the very top of government. Action thriller, based on Tom Clancys novel, with Harrison Ford reprising his role from Patriot Games alongside Willem Dafoe, Anne Archer and James Earl Jones

programme.title: Oceans 8
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of brother Danny, light-fingered Debbie Ocean plans to steal the Toussaint, a $150million necklace from Vogues Met Gala, with the help of a famous actress. Crime caper, starring Sandra Bullock, Cate Blanchett, Anne Hathaway and Mindy Kaling

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: A London cocaine dealer is all set to leave the criminal world behind and start a new life abroad. However, his plans are thwarted when he is asked to track down a gangsters drug-addicted daughter and locate a stolen shipment of Ecstasy. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney, Kenneth Cranham and Sienna Miller

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patients fractured mind as a 24th character with apparent superhuman abilities attempts to dominate his body. M Night Shyamalans thriller, starring James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy and Betty Buckley

programme.title: Black Bag
programme.desc: When a spy is suspected of treason, her husband faces the ultimate test - loyalty to his marriage or his country. Director Steven Soderberghs thriller, starring Michael Fassbender, Cate Blanchett and Rege-Jean Page

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A serial killer attempts to evade a police blockade while attending a concert with his daughter. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Ariel Donoghue, Saleka Shyamalan and Hayley Mills

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor
programme.desc: A bookish CIA researcher returns to his field office to find all his colleagues have been murdered in his absence. When he tries to uncover the truth, he also ends up targeted for assassination by his own agency, and is forced to go on the run to discover the reasons why. Sydney Pollacks thriller, starring Robert Redford, Faye Dunaway, Cliff Robertson and Max von Sydow

programme.title: Pulp Fiction
programme.desc: A series of interlinked stories about the Los Angeles underworld. A hitman plays minder to his bosss wife, and he and his partner deal with a dead body following a mishap with a gun. Meanwhile, a washed-up boxer goes on the run after refusing to throw a fight, and two lovers plot a hold-up in a diner. Quentin Tarantinos crime drama, starring John Travolta, Samuel L Jackson, Uma Thurman, Bruce Willis, Ving Rhames, Tim Roth and Amanda Plummer

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: International thief Simon Templar, a cunning master of disguise with a Swiss bank account almost full enough to retire on, accepts one last job - to steal a female scientists formula for cold fusion. However, he breaks his own golden rule by getting emotionally involved with the woman, leading to a deadly chase as the pair meet up in Russia and try to flee from the real bad guys. Action adventure, starring Val Kilmer, Elisabeth Shue and Henry Goodman

programme.title: Sharp Corner

programme.desc: A former army sniper is arrested following a random shooting that leaves five people dead, but protests his innocence. An elusive former military police investigator is called in to examine the case, and becomes convinced a conspiracy is at work. Action thriller based on Lee Childs novel One Shot, starring Tom Cruise, Rosamund Pike, Werner Herzog and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A serial killer attempts to evade a police blockade while attending a concert with his daughter. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Ariel Donoghue, Saleka Shyamalan and Hayley Mills

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Autistic number-cruncher Christian Wolff moonlights as a money launderer for the Mob. However, the Treasury Department start closing in on him, so he decides to take on a legitimate client in the form of a robotics company. As he works through their books, he uncovers a discrepancy involving millions of dollars. Action-packed thriller, starring Ben Affleck, Anna Kendrick and JK Simmons

programme.title: Sleepers
programme.desc: Four teenagers are sentenced to reform school after a prank results in the accidental death of an old man, and suffer sexual abuse at the hands of the guards. Years later, when the boys have grown up and begun to follow very different professions, a chance encounter with one of their abusers inspires them to plot revenge. Drama, starring Brad Pitt, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman, Kevin Bacon, Jason Patric and Minnie Driver

Ridley Scotts thriller sequel, starring Anthony Hopkins, Julianne Moore, Gary Oldman and Ray Liotta

programme.desc: Thrown out of a restaurant and forced to take shelter in a museum on Christmas Eve, Will, Grace, Karen and Jack end up whisked back in time to New York of 1912. There they find that Karen is a poor Irish immigrant feeding nine children on stolen onions, Jack her burly muscular sailor lodger, Will their penny-pinching landlord and Grace his oblivious wife. Karen worries she will have to sell her body to Will to pay the rent, but Jack realises that Will is unlikely to take that offer. programme.title: Greatest Escapes of WWII
programme.desc: A look at some of the most incredible escapes of the conflict, as captured soldiers, sailors and airmen on both sides dared the impossible to win their freedom. This episodes focuses on Colditz Castle, the Great Escape and the bold Warburg Wire Job

programme.title: Greatest Escapes of WWII

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In 2017, it was revealed that the US Department of Defence had spent millions investigating reports of UFOs. This is the latest disclosure about a series of secret government UFO projects dating back decades, but findings have yet to be released to the public. This extended episode contemplates whether an extraterrestrial presence on Earth is part of a conspiracy

programme.title: Alien Files Reopened
programme.desc: Electrical physicist Paul Bennewitz was convinced he had located a top secret human and alien underground lab in Dulce, New Mexico near Los Alamos. programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.sub-title: A Lost Tudor Hall in Odiham
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team are in Odiham, Hampshire, searching for the house of Sir Frances Walsingham, the head of Elizabeth Is Secret Service. It is the first time the site has ever been dug, so with very little to go on, our team want to locate the house, work out its size and scale, and what Walsingham may have used it for. As part of the investigation, Hugh turns his hand to spy craft as he learns how Walsingham used to break codes

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.sub-title: Stirling - First War of Scottish Independence
programme.desc: US YouTube sensation Beau Ouimette, a river detectorist with over 30 years experience, pairs up with presenter and keen swimmer Rick Edwards, to search the UKs waterways in search of archaeological finds. In the opening episode, the pair tackle the River Forth in the shadow of Stirling Castle. In the first archaeological river search of this spot, they set out on the hunt for relics of Scotlands greatest medieval warriors, William Wallace and Robert the Bruce, revealing secrets from the battle sites of their most famous victories against their hated English overlords

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: The team is called in to end a hostage situation and discovers one of the captives is a wanted felon, while Hondo uses his day off to hunt for a serial rapist

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The NCIS team helps naval intelligence officer Akhil Ali locate a colleague who went missing while recruiting foreign assets as potential sources of intelligence. Callen is joined by psychologist Nate Getz as he tries to track down a man he believes was present for his training when he was young

programme.desc: Coverage from the UK-based version of the six-a-side football league, which takes place at Copper Box Arena in London. programme.title: Live NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Cleveland Cavaliers v Milwaukee Bucks (Tip-off 12.00am). Coverage of the Eastern Conference match at Rocket Arena. These teams last met on October 26, when the Cavaliers claimed a hard-fought 118-113 victory at this venue, despite an impressive individual performance from the Bucks Giannis Antetokounmpo that saw him register 40 points, 14 rebounds and nine assists

programme.title: EFL Cup Retro
programme.sub-title: Retro Efl Cup Final 2009: Manchester United V Tottenham
programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur in the 2008/09 final. Spurs were managed by Harry Redknapp and had a strong run that led them to the final of the competition, having beaten the likes of Newcastle, Liverpool and Watford in previous rounds. The Red Devils had beaten Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Blackburn Rovers in the early rounds, before beating Derby County 4-3 on aggregate

programme.desc: In February 2011, a week before her 39th birthday, Esra Uyrun went to her local shop to buy a pint of milk. The mother-of-one left her home in Clondalkin, Dublin, and was never seen again. Esras sister Berna and friend Ilknur, travel to Ireland from the UK several times a year, dedicating every minute spent in Ireland to finding answers in the hope someone will come forward with new information. This programme offers an insight into the relentless appeal for information and the heartbreak that the families of missing persons endure

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers

programme.title: Railroad Australia

programme.title: Aussie Road Train Truckers
programme.desc: Scotty transports a $30,000 haystack but has a problem with his trailer, a town that Jake is heading to is on fire, and Des tries to make it up a very steep hill

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond is dropped into the remote, frozen wastes of Canada to test a watch with a built-in emergency beacon. The distress signal is sent directly to Jeremy Clarkson and James May, who get their hands on two machines and set off on an epic adventure to find their colleague. Jeremy puts the 471bhp Lexus RC F coupe thought its paces, and actress Gillian Anderson takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May straps into a highly tuned hatchback as he competes in a world rallycross race, with Top Gear USA host and professional driver Tanner Foust teaming up with him. Jeremy Clarkson puts the Jaguar F-type R and Eagles modernised E-type the Low Drag GT though their paces, while Richard Hammond is in Spain to test the Mazda MX-5. Plus, X-Men: First Class star Nicholas Hoult takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers revisit the 1970s, a decade which is all too often unfairly stigmatised for its food. They show how a well-prepared chicken cordon bleu and banoffee pie can be a contemporary gastronomic delight, before heading to a restaurant whose menu harks back to that era

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: At Golitha Falls, where the River Fowey tumbles down to the sea, Rick meets Dawn French, who has made Cornwall her home. In the shadow of Devonport Dockyard, he boards the worlds busiest chain ferry to cross the wide River Tamar, the ancient watery boundary between Devon and Cornwall - along the way discovering an unusual event involving circus elephant. And he meets a man who thinks he has discovered the next superfood, which Rick used to cook up a delicious duck dish

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick heads into the countys china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold, one of its most important industries. He then climbs the Cornish Alps, huge slag heaps created by the clay mining and some of Cornwalls highest land. After a wild swim at one of Cornwalls picturesque hidden coves, Rick cooks a simple sea bass recipe, revealing how to make the perfect mayonnaise. In the far west of the county, on the Lands End peninsula, Rick meets his niece, a modern artist, who explains her deep spiritual connection to Cornwall

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Bangor in Co Down to help Mandy McCreight, who is isolated in her bedroom due to a variety of medical issues and is missing out on family life. Her children Ben and Kara also have mobility problems, while husband Davey looks after everyone, but now he is suffering from a back injury. The entire family are under real stress and the house is not wheelchair friendly, making the situation unbearable

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Scunthorpe woman Caroline Blanchard, a single mum who has twice had to make the decision to turn off the life support for people she loves. She and her children live in the shadow of the garage, where seven-year-old Natasha banged her head in 2007, and the conservatory, where husband and father Paul had a heart attack four years later. The volunteers plan is to give them a new home for a new start, including demolishing the conservatory and garage where these two tragedies occurred

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: After 15 years of fostering, Stephen and Lynn Smedley were looking forward to their well-earned retirement in Carbis Bay, Cornwall. However, the dream dramatically changed when their daughter died, leaving them caring for their three grandsons. The boys, still grieving for their mums untimely death, are forced to share a single bedroom with a triple bunkbed. There is only one bathroom and Lynn is forced to do the ironing in the shed due to lack of space. Enter Nick Knowles and the team. Their plan is to reconfigure and enlarge their home to accommodate three growing boys - with the help of hundreds of volunteers

programme.title: DIY SOS

programme.title: MasterChef USA
programme.desc: The Top 10 duos, in a pier-side setting, are tasked with feeding over 100 local fishermen and women - the worst performing team faces the Pressure Test

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing and TOWIE star Pete Wicks immerses himself in the heart-warming and emotional world of dog care at Basildons Dogs Trust rehoming centre. Its Petes first day at Dogs Trust, and he meets a pug facing a worrying surgery and pregnant dog who was seized at the border

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Spaniel Scrumpy is suffering from lameness and Noel discovers he has a collapsed disc and severe elbow arthritis. He already has a chequered medical history totalling six previous operations to his elbows, hip and knee. Meanwhile, there is an emergency admission when a 15-month-old dachshund arrives with a mystery brain condition, and Noel and his neurology colleagues have their work cut out to identify the cause. When his condition rapidly deteriorates overnight, suddenly the life of this much-loved young dog hangs in the balance

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Four-year-old pug and beagle cross Barney is brought into Fitzpatrick Referrals after being hit by a bus. The dog has lost 40 per cent of the bone in the damaged leg, so Noel creates an innovative two-tier treatment, involving an external ankle frame for support. Sisters Rosemary and Diane bring in their five-year-old basset hound Albert when they find he is suddenly unable to move his back legs, and 10-month-old Labrador cross Gylly receives treatment for lameness and an unusual bone deformity

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Emma grew up living with who she thought were her mother, father and sisters, until her mum was diagnosed with cancer and her family decided it was time to tell her the truth. She discovered one of her sisters was really her biological mother. With a baby on the way and boyfriend Ben by her side, the 17-year-old is determined to take a different path and declare no more family secrets. Bethany and Dan reflect on an emotional four years of trying to have a child, while pregnant Rachel talks about how she may have to change religion and move away from home to be with her partner

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sarah and Jonathan met at junior school as eight-year-olds and were best friends for years until they eventually got together. Now theyre in Southmead expecting their second baby, but the mother-to-be is getting increasingly anxious and the memory of her difficult first labour begins to induce a panic attack. Meanwhile, Vikki and Jack are having their first child and are keen for a big family after going through lonely and troubled upbringings themselves, while Naomi has to spend the night in hospital away from her partner Chris as she waits for labour to kick in

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: The finalists level up childhood favourites and cater for a celebrity party attended by Michael Dapaah and AJ Tracey, with the help of the eliminated cooks

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Saffys pregnancy sends her mum off the deep end, bringing nightmares about becoming a grandmother, her torture compounded by the taunting midwife. Luckily, Eddies new celebrity book club started with Patsy takes her mind off her troubles, as Mariella Frostrup promises to bring her famous friends

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Lithuanian mother-to-be Olga Kozlova goes into labour, but refuses to allow her husband Victor into the delivery room, selecting her mother Galina to accompany her instead. However, without an interpreter on hand, the pair have difficulty communicating with the midwives. Vicki Thompson also prepares to give birth, and discusses how she and her partner Ben have used tattoos to mark life-changing events since they met

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team are in Corby, Northamptonshire, to complete a build for Jackie and Colin Hutchison and their three children. The eldest, Jordan, has cerebral palsy and epilepsy - but this has not stopped him raising huge sums of money for charity. However, he and his family are currently living with his grandmother after a after a series of building issues left them without the money to complete their own home renovation. As ever, Nick Knowles and the team, plus hundreds of local workers, arrive to change this familys life in just a few short days

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Barnstaple in Devon to help Jan and Lucy, whose daily four-hour round trips to hospital for life-saving dialysis treatment for two of their daughters is taking a heavy toll on family life. Along with designer Laurence Llewelyn Bowen and hundreds of local volunteers, Nick and the crew extend their house to create a home dialysis centre, enabling the girls to be treated where they live and letting the whole family settle into a healthier and happier routine

programme.title: MasterChef USA
programme.desc: The five pairs on the losing team from the previous round face the first pressure test of the series, a dessert Mystery Box challenge

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a litter of puppies known as the Potato Pups, who were found abandoned in a crisp box, and helps the staff fight to keep them alive

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Nicola and Tim, who are both nurses, hope their second childs birth will be less dramatic than their first, who was born after an emergency C-section. Expectant mum Laura, 29, has battled anorexia nervosa since she was a teenager and was told she would never be able to have children because of the impact of her eating disorder. However, she and partner Delroy are now looking forward to the arrival of baby number three. Tracy is days past her due date and her little one is refusing to make an appearance

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Its all hands on deck as Southmead Hospitals maternity ward reaches maximum capacity, and the midwives are concerned that the unit may have to close. Among the new arrivals are Mormon couple Jennie and Jon, who are expecting their third child, and nervous first-time parents Eve and Andy, who experienced difficulties during their two previous pregnancies

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: Paramedics are called to a seven-year-old boy gasping for air, and a team deals with a multi-vehicle accident where a rescue is hampered by downed power lines

programme.title: Ambulance Australia
programme.desc: A child calls for help when a five-year-old gets stuck in the mud, and an alert about a suspected stroke at a workplace leads responders to an intoxicated man

programme.title: My Family
programme.sub-title: And Ill Cry if I Want To
programme.desc: Another Christmas with the Harper family sees Scrooge-like patriarch Ben at his most miserable, as wife Susan is busy giving grandson Kenzo a third birthday to remember, his hated mother-in-law Grace gets herself a toyboy and eldest son Nick sends a present that could have a lasting effect on the entire household. Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker star, with Daniela Denby-Ashe, Gabriel Thomson, Siobhan Hayes and Rosemary Leach

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Under the Knife
programme.desc: The roving broadcaster travels to California, the birthplace of plastic surgery, to investigate the obsession with beauty and self-image. In his quest he meets Eve, a domineering stylist and her client Laura, and DJ Kris, who is resorting to liposuction to achieve the six-pack he so desires, leading Louis to consider having a nip and tuck himself

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is at Elgins port, the coastal town of Lossiemouth, where the Labour Partys first prime minister James Ramsay MacDonald was born. Nearby, Michael finds a remote boarding school established in the 1930s and famous today both for its unusual ideas and its royal former pupils. His penultimate stop is Inverness, where he uncovers the work of female photographer MEM Donaldson, who documented a Highland way of life that was rapidly disappearing. Michaels journey ends at Loch Ness, where he joins a Deep Scan research team scouring the deep for signs of the elusive monster

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the West Country between the wars, setting off from the Cornish seaside resort of St Ives and ending his first in the former mining village of St Day. He visits Britains first studio pottery, where he attempts a decorative wax technique and feels the heat of the firing kiln. Michael also joins a family on holiday in a railway carriage called Harvey

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Cornwalls county town, Truro, heading to the historic estate of Trewithen, whose gardens were stocked from China by professional plant hunters commissioned by its owner. The Atlantic Coast branch line carries Michael north to Newquay, where he discovers a pioneering surfer and braves the waves on a belly board. In the nearby village of St Mawgan, Michael is introduced to the ancient Cornish sport of wrassling, which surged in popularity between the wars as part of a Cornish Celtic revival

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Bodmin en route to Totnes, as he explores the West Country from St Ives to Salisbury Plain. Out on the rugged moor, Michael hears how the celebrated author Daphne du Maurier captivated readers between the wars with her tales of smuggling at the Jamaica Inn. In Devon, Michael takes the plunge at Plymouths beautiful art deco Tinside Lido, while at Ivybridge, he boards a vehicle like no other to cross the causeway to Burgh Island, where a 1930s playboy built a splendid art deco party palace

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Scotland in the mother of all rainstorms to pick up a Jaguar E-type and a rare MGC convertible. Plus, Dave extracts a rare Austin Gipsey from a lock up

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Theres a surprise for Derek in Hull - an MGSA sports car that once had a tree growing through it. Plus, in North Wales, Alan Holmes is selling his sons Ford Escort RS 1600i

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Account of Operation Barbarossa, Germanys plan to invade the Soviet Union in 1941, revealing the massive human and financial cost endured by the Soviet people, who fought a bloody and lonely war with little support from the Allies. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents expert assessments of items not initially shown in programmes from visits to Abbotsford and Burghley. Treasures include a jewel box made for a princess but never given to her, a Chinese watercolour with a staggering valuation, and the oldest walking stick ever brought to a Roadshow

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Chester Cathedral, where objects under scrutiny include a sheriffs ring of office, a collection of hand-carved wooden shoes and a painting that has been left lying under a bed for many years

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Pauls on a big day out collecting a 1971 Jaguar E-Type and a 1933 Morgan three-wheeler Supersport, but first theres a flock of 300 chickens to negotiate before he can load up

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming explores the English canal network, beginning with a journey from Shardlow to Etruria Junction, Stoke on Trent, exploring the Trent and Mersey Canal. programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second leg of Simons journey begins at the Giants Causeway, before visiting a kelp farm on Rathlin Island. He heads to the Dark Hedges in Co Antrim, one of the filming locations from Game of Thrones, and visits Belfast for the July 12 parades, discovering how the event has divided the city. He also learns more about Oliver Cromwells influence on Ireland, attends the Gaze film festival, and meets monkeys at an animal sanctuary in the Wicklow mountains

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the county line from Devon into Somerset, seeing first-hand how willow farmers sought to overcome the challenge from the production of synthetic plastics during the 1930s and hearing how tourism has spread across the region, especially amongst the young. In Bath, Michael visits the former home of a refugee emperor, whose country was invaded by the Italian dictator Mussolini, and in whose name a religious movement began that now flourishes worldwide. Travelling east into Wiltshire, he reaches the largest training area of the British Army, Salisbury Plain

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the east of England in the inter-war period, starting in Canterbury, Kent, where he treads the boards as he uncovers the political message behind a 1936 play, inspired by the 12th-century murder of Archbishop Thomas a Becket. In Maidstone, he learns of the international origins of the most British symbol of remembrance. Outside Sevenoaks, Michael visits the country home of Winston Churchill, and discovers how the 1930s were wilderness years at Chartwell, as Churchill warned against Nazi appeasement. Once in the capital, he heads to Alexandra Palace, the birthplace of television

As well as being stripped of one of its three stars by the tourist board, the hotel has received a succession of scathing internet reviews, and owner Karen Lloyd has lost more than £32,000. After spending a night in the establishment, Alex sends in the deep cleaners, renovates the bedrooms and reorganises the staff in a bid to transform the hotels reputation

Delving into the victims story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist.
